_header: O Lord God what it is great pleasaunce
_description: A Balade attributed to the Duke of Suffolk — three stanzas rhyme royal

BodFair16.First Lines:
O lord god what yt is gret plesaunceffor me to thynke so goodly and
                    so fayr…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…I know her not olyue that in thys caseIs bettir worthy ther
                    to haue a place

Norton-Smith,  John.

         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
